Package ru.nsu.fit.smolyakov.caclulator.operation

Class Operation<T>

java.lang.Object
ru.nsu.fit.smolyakov.caclulator.operation.Operation<T>
public class Operation<T> extends Object
Represents an operation upon operands of the same type, producing a result of the same type as the operands. Implemented for internal use with Calculator.

This class imposes some restrictions preventing possible mistakes while applying a function, whose amount of arguments might be not clear. Futhermore, default apply (or compute) method doesn't exist, as it is not used by Calculator.

Implements currying by eponymous curry(T) method. Currying is the technique of translating the evaluation of a function that takes multiple arguments into evaluating a sequence of functions, each with a single argument. For example, currying a function f that takes three arguments creates a nested unary function g, so that f(a, b, c) is equal to g(a)(b)(c). Although this operation is destructive, a new instance of initial state of this Operation can be created by uncurriedCopy().

Allows the user to get arity() of the current (respectively, curried) function. One strictly should be non-negative number, and this fact is checked by both methods and mutable methods.

get() method allows to get the value supplied by 0-arity function. (So, the only way to get a value from the function represented by this class is by using consistent currying).

      public void curry(T arg)

      Throws:
